etymology.description: 草(草) (cǎo, "grass; herb") refers to herbaceous plants, and 莓(莓) (méi, "berry") denotes small, pulpy, edible fruits. Together they form 草莓(草莓) (cǎoméi, "strawberry"), a small, red, juicy fruit commonly considered a type of small berry.
etymology.interpretation: The word 草莓(草莓) (cǎoméi, "strawberry") literally means a 'herb berry,' reflecting both the plant nature of strawberries and their status as small, sweet fruits.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃草莓(我喜歡吃草莓)。
市场上有很多草莓(市場上有很多草莓)，味道香甜(味道香甜)。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shàng yǒu hěn duō cǎoméi, wèidào xiāngtián.
examples.english: There are many strawberries in the market, and they taste very sweet.
